column4: when i start my pc and prompted which os to use, why is that i have 7 choices to choose from. linux kernel 2.6.12-9-686, recovery fail safe, linux kernel 2.6.12-9-686, recovery fail safe, linux kernel 2.6.12-9-686, recovery fail safe, and windows. why is that i have 3 linux and 3 failesafe which are just the same
help pls
Well, you have duplicate entries for whatever reason. It shouldn't hurt anything.
If you are brave, you can edit them by going to /boot/grub/menu.lst
You have to use sudo
Did you use sudo gedit to open the file?
From another terminal window, just to be safe, type "sudo cp /boot/grub/menu.lst /boot/grub/menu.lst.bak"
Then, feel free to remove entries that appear to be duplicates.
copy
Are you installing it through Synaptic?
Or did you download a .deb package?
Well... I don't know where you got this package, from from the terminal type sudo dpkg --install w32codecs.deb

dude i got this error. " dpkg: error processing w32codecs_20050412-0.0_i386.deb (--install): cannot access archive: No such file or directory Errors were encountered while processing:  w32codecs_20050412-0.0_i386.deb
Make sure you are in the right directory.
From the terminal, if you hit tab it will autocomplete entries.
So you don't have to type the entire name out by hand.
Type a few letters of the file and then hit tab.
It works for directories as well.
You have to be in the directory the file is in.
It can be a timesaver, just wanted to let you know that.
I don't know if there is one. Alt + F2 opens the run dialog.
